subject: Communication
title: Malala's United Nations Speech
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Malala's United Nations Speech.

hook.text: A 16-year-old stood before the United Nations â€” nine months after being shot in the head by the Taliban.

buildup.text: Malala Yousafzai had survived an assassination attempt for advocating girls' education in Pakistan.

discovery.text: She said: 'One child, one teacher, one book, and one pen can change the world.' Simple and devastating.

twist.text: Her power wasn't polish or technique. It was lived experience meeting moral clarity.

climax.text: She became the youngest Nobel laureate. Her speech proved that authority comes from truth, not age.

punchline.text: The strongest voice in the room was sixteen years old.

quiz.question: How old was Malala when she addressed the United Nations?
